overview: “A land art film that examines the poverty of a residential block in the South Bronx. Torched stolen cars, abandoned mutt dogs and dirty laundry are a few of the visual anchors that weave this location study together. This film was shot on Tri-X film and in-camera edited using a 16mm Bolex camera” (Joey Huertas). (Screened 2/17/22 at MoMA as part of Millennium Film Workshop: “Nighttime” NYC event).
title: D-Blok Snag
